name: Hotel Churchill

reviews.title: A superb holiday!
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at this quaint, comfortable and very friendly hotel. The staff in this Family run hotel could not have been kinder or more helpful. The hotel is perfectly located for a visit to the Bayeux Tapastry, Cathedral and Battle of Normandy Museum. In addition, it is a minute's walk away from the pickup point for the Beach tours. The hotel shuttle bus to Mont St. Michel is a must! The driver is friendly and very well informed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful and was patient with my poor French. Good restaurant recommendations. The room was clean and comfortable but not fancy. We did not sample the breakfast room as there were so many cafes within an easy walk. The van to Mont St. Michel was driven by Maurice and he was chatty and informative...could sell ice to Eskimos.
reviews.title: 3 great nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Our room faced a noisy street but not a huge problem. A 3 minute walk to the Tapestry.
reviews.title: Iconic hotel fits the bill for exploring the WWII beaches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This older hotel with it iconic memorabilia from WWII is perfect headquarters to see the landing beaches. Don't expect 4* surroundings but adequate nonetheless. The breakfasts are continental European style and the ladies serving coffee are friendly, particularly if you try some French.
reviews.title: Upbeat personnel and great property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights. You could say that the atmosphere is like a small hotel. Everybody is very merry (even in the morning), and it works infectious. And the building also looks small, but they do have a lot of rooms, you just have to look for them through hallways and little stairs.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestled amongst the canals of the River Aure and ancient cobble stone streets, the Chruchill Hotel provided us with a beautiful resting place in the heart of Normandy. It is decorated to inspire a warm upscale British feel and the walls are covered in WWII photographs and memorabilia. It is a two minute walk to most of the best restaurants and shopping Bayeux has to offer. There is free parking five minutes away (Just ask front desk). There is a nice grocery store right next door. We had a little trouble finding the place due to the cute little streets that wind around the city center but the reward is worth it. Our room did not have A/C but the cool August air kept us very comfortable at night. The front desk staff were extremely helpful making reservations and even assisting us in making reservations for a Paris river cruise. The owner, Eric, obviously takes service very seriously. I don’t think we could have asked for a better hotel to set the mood for our visit to Normandy.
reviews.title: Cute, great service, WWII-Centric

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Churchill Hotel is located right in the middle of the tourist portion of downtown Bayeau. One side faces a pedestrian street with lots of quaint shops and restaurants. Other side features a small patio great for evening refreshments. Room was comfortable with modern furnishings. The lobby and hallways have photo of WWII. The friendly staff provided information about local attractions, tours, etc. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: So glad we stayed in this city of Bayeux. This hotel was not fancy, but had updated bathrooms. We thought the street side of the hotel was going to be quiet at night, but with some show near the Cathedral letting out at 10:30 & 11:30 pm, it didn't happen that way. I would suggest asking for a room on the court side of the hotel, b/c the doors open completely, for fresh air, as opposed to the windows in our room. Bathroom window curtain was almost transparent, which led me to do some 'limbo moves' to protect my privacy. We did have breakfast one morning, opted not to the next and found a delicious bakery up the street. The staff at this hotel were pleasant, and we saw many guests taking the Normandy tour van. The hotel next door, The Villa Lara, was nice, as I stopped in to compare "ratings."
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location very friendly staff. It is an old rustic hotel that you will love. Had a great place to sit outside and enjoy a good bottle of wine. Rooms were comfortable.Breakfast was excellent. One issue is the hotel does not have an elevator but the staff will carry your bags to your room. The location is graet for anything in Bayreax. The hotel serves a great breakfast.
reviews.title: Hotel Churchill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were pleased with the Churchill Hotel, mostly because of it is close to the cathedral and everything in town and we especially liked all the history and pictures they have on display. It is a good place to stay since the Overlord Tours of the beaches start right near there and the hotel also has a van that goes to Mont St. Michel, although next time I would consider renting a car, as the van is pretty expensive and our driver was anxious to get us back to the hotel to catch the afternoon group. As another reviewer has said, the room is clean and comfortable but not fancy. Nice bathroom and decent bed which is most important. From our room you could see the steeples of the cathedral and it was magnificent. you do have to cart your luggage upstairs, fortunately we were only up one flight of stairs. The breakfast is very European and I agree the lady serving the coffee is the friendliest of all the staff. There are many shops just behind (? if I have my directions right) that stretch for a mile or more. With many dress shops etc. The farmers market is okay for food stuff but disappointing in any souvenirs. I do recommend going on the Overlord tour of the beaches (see separate review) and the tapestries and we also went to Honfleur which I highly recommend. There is so much to do in Normandy that I wish we could have spent a week or two here. Mont St. Michel to me is the 2nd most important visit, after the beaches. I recommend Le Pommier restaurant (near the cathedral) for a more expensive dinner; we ended up several times at a little bistro Le Drakkar, about two blocks from the hotel. Good pizza, salads and very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Convenient and historic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great location. The hotel is only a few steps from the Bayeux Tapestry, and only a few more to the wonderful cathedral. And, Hotel owner 'Rima' became our personal concierge, recommending wonderful restaurants, making reservations, and helping with all our sightseeing needs. Our room was extremely spacious and a great cozy change from the fast pace of Paris from the previous week. AND, what a great ADDED BONUS - the hotel just started their own van to the glorious Mont Saint Michel daily, leaving the hotel at 9:00 AM, then arriving at the abby at 10:30 AM - letting your tour at your own pace for 3 hours then returning to the hotel by 3:00 PM. They take you right to the front steps of the abby, round-trip for only 55 Euros per person - much easier and less expensive than renting a car. We will definitely stay again next time in Bayeux or the Normandy region.
reviews.title: It's All About Location and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lynn & Sandra Booker
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: San Antonio, Texas
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in the Hotel Churchill in March and it was just perfect. We were traveling with 14 people, 3 families with a total of 8 teenagers. The Hotel Churchill was very nice and the staff very friendly and warm. The rooms worked out perfectly and the little breakfast area/
reviews.title: Great Anniversary
Great base for Normandy
reviews.text: bar was a wonderful place for all of us to gather. I would go back in a minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a one night stay as we wanted to visit Mt. Saint Michel and this hotel offers a convenient shuttle to/from the site which is otherwise difficult to reach without a car. The hotel is centrally located in Bayeux and a short walk to the major sites of the town such as the tapestry museum and cathedral. We took a half day trip to the Normandy beaches as well, with the pick-up point for the tour being within spitting distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel and homebase for the Normandy sights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were ok, clean and neat--however, try to ask for a room on the first floor as there is no elevator and its quite difficult to drag heavy suitcases up a small staircase.
reviews.title: Nice Quaint Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot comment on the breakfast, as we knew it was an additional 12 euro a person, we went to the supermarket right next door and got our own croissants and juice. So if anyone had issue with that, it was easily solved to just buy your own food.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall--I would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Hotel Churchill makes you feel at home!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, Quaint Hotel
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: I have just returned from my stay in Normandy and the Hotel Churchill. I was visiting with my grandfather and uncle because my grandfather is a veteran of WWII. The Hotel Churchill was very helpful in getting us there, telling us about the town of Bayeux, and making sure our stay was as enjoyable as possible. I really cannot thank the staff enough for everything they did for us seeing as that we speak very limited French. The hotel was very clean and well kept and contained many historical photographs which was a plus for us since we were returning to visit the D-Day beaches and monuments. Thanks again to everyone at the hotel who made our trip unforgettable.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Ross Andrew
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (grandson of Donald Englar)
reviews.title: Outstanding Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel after reading several favorable reviews in Tripadvisor. The experience was quite satisfactory, both in correspondence and at the hotel. Exceptional service by all personnel, helpful attention from Madame Hebert, the owner/manager, and a good location in the old town, just a few minutes from the cathedral and tapestry. We would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Normandy

likes.liked: — The hospitality of the hosts and the charming decor.
likes.disliked: — Noise from the main street nearby.

reviews.title: Bayeux is wonderful
reviews.text: We booked Hotel Churchill online based on recommendations read on TripAdvisor and we were not at all disappointed. Mme. Hebert promptly replied to our email request in English and we were all set.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: This is one of the most lovely hotel's I have stayed in. I would highly recommend it to family and friends.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels in France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's in the town of Bayeux, which is also adorable. Though we arrived late at night the hotel staff were very accomadating. My room was on the second floor and it was very nice and clean. It looked as though it had just been renovated recently. The room over looked the street. However there was no noise. Funny considering there was a bar/cafe right across the street.
reviews.title: Beautiful Bayeux made even better by The Churchill
Clean...Warm and Friendly
reviews.text: The Breakfast was included with the meal and it was perfect. I loved coming down to the dining room and smelling the fresh bread and pastries. The french coffee was to die for. Especailly since I had just left England and had the worse coffee ever, so this was a great relief.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Owners are wonderful people. They truly take pride in their Hotel and the way they treat their Guests. The made the Hotel a fantastic place to stay. I can't wait to get back there and stay.
reviews.title: A gem in a lovely city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: There are quite a few stores and restaurants right there. A grocery store next door which came in handy for bottle water and fruit for the outing's we were on.
reviews.title: Terrific Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I and our two teenage sons stayed at the Churchill Hotel for four nights in August. The location was perfect: near a pedestrian street filled with restaurants, patisseries, charcuteries, boutiques, a little grocery store, a laundromat, bank,... and near the Tapisserie Museum. It was a couple yards away from the meeting point for the Overlord Tours we booked. Great location for visiting Bayeux by foot without killing yourself. The staff was gracious, helpful and very accommodating. We had a room with a double bed and a loft with two twin beds. we had a tv and wifi! The bathroom was extremely spacious. Breakfast included coffee, tea, cocoa, juices, cheeses, cold cuts, croissants, pains au chocolat, baguette, fresh fruit, yogurt,...served in a very charming room. You could also enjoy beverages served in the courtyard during the day and evening (we brought our own pastries). So pleasant and so relaxing! Perfect location. Gracious staff. Merci, Daniel. I will highly recommend the hotel to my friends and family.
reviews.title: A Delightful Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled via train from Paris to Bayeux, the final stop on our 3-week European vacation. We were traveling "light" and chose to walk the short distance to the hotel from the train station (but taxis are available).
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Churchill was a fitting highlight to our trip.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The desk staff at Hotel Churchill is helpful and friendly. Even though we had arrived early, our room happened to be ready and the desk clerk checked us in.
reviews.title: Great location but the rooms leave much to be desired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed two nights in a large, comfortable room, one flight up via a tightly-curved staircase (just carry your bag on the wide side of the curve), overlooking a small street. The large, well-lit, very modern bathroom featured tub/shower combo, dual sinks with mirrors, and his and hers terry-cloth robes. (Toilet was conveniently separate)
reviews.title: Ideal for a short break
Bayeux tapestry
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed in this comfortable hotel. The staff are incredibly helpful and accommodating. Meals are served in a lovely glassed in conservatory. The hotel is in the main street handy to the tourist bureau shops restaurants and laundrette. There is good parking in the hotel courtyard. The Churchill is close to the bus stop for tours to the Normany landing beaches and war graves. The Bayeux Tapestry is nearby. Trains run from the railway station to Caen, Coutances and Pontorson from where buses travel 10 minutes to Mont St Michel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We visited Bayeux in November with three friends, one of whom was a veteran of the Normandy invasion. The Hotel Churchill was perfect for our stay: room was adequate, location was great, and best of all was the hospitality of the couple who own the hotel. They made us feel very comfortable and were especially wonderful to our veteran friend. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Normandy.
reviews.title: Great value & hospitality
A great, no EXCELLENT, place to stay
reviews.text: I stayed in Bayeaux at the Chruchill for four days in the middle of September. This due to the reviews on Tripadvisor. The owners are on site every day and I can't say enough about them and their staff. One night I just stayed in the room, called down for some ice and sparkling water. The room service actually ran up the two flights to my room-talk about prompt!

reviews.title: Charm, professionalism and superb assitsnce
reviews.text: This is a great, centrally located Hotel to the invasion area. The tour buses and cars pick up up in the courtyard. The tapestry and the whole town is right outside the door there- very convenient. The town of Bayeaux is a picture postcard of the small towns in France that I expected to see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all a wonderful place to stay and BE.
reviews.title: We loved Bayeux and the Hotel Churchill

likes.liked: — Location and it was so quaint
likes.disliked: — there is nothing that i can say that i did not like

description: A distinctive hotel on a pedestrian street in the heart of old Bayeux in Normandy.A charming hotel where history and memory trade tails.2 minutes from the famous tapestry and the cathedral and from Place de Quebec the pick up point for all excursions departing to the Dday landing beaches.
